overview: This subject introduces Jazz & Improvisation students to advanced rhythmic concepts and techniques.
Through practical performance activities, deep listening exercises and transcription, students learn to creatively navigate complex rhythmic environments as players and listeners.
This subject is only available to students enrolled in theJazz and Improvisationmajor of the B-MUS Bachelor of Music.
intended learning outcomes: perform complex rhythms, rhythmic structures, and polyrhythms;
transcribe complex rhythms, rhythmic structures and polyrhythms;
aurally distinguish rhythms, polyrhythms and complex meters within rhythmically complex performance contexts.

additional pre-requisite: Admission into the Jazz & Improvisation major in the B-MUS Bachelor of Music

non-allowed subjects: MUSI30238 Advanced Harmonic and Rhythmic Studies

assessments.description: One 3-minute viva voce practical test on complex rhythms and rhythmic structures. 10 hours (of work required)
Transcribe a 2 to 3-minute piece of music (800 words equivalent). 20 hours (of work required)
One 6-minute viva voce practical examination on complex rhythms, rhythmic structures, and polyrhythms. 20 hours (of work required)
Hurdle requirement:. Students must attend a minimum of 80% of all scheduled classes and performances as directed.

Semester 1.Contact hours: 12 hours, comprising one 1-hour practical class per week

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.
